Impulse is an accumulated force exerted over time. It is measured in Newtons (N) if mass is in kilograms (kg), but it is not a scalar quantity; rather, it is a vector quantity where magnitude and direction of impulse are determined by the direction of force (F) and integration time (T). So how do you know where the impulse is? You really want to know if, for example, the force $F$ equals the change in the momentum $P$. Well, you can integrate the force over a period of change in the momentum. If the impulse, $P$, is not known, then to find it we have to write the force $F$ as $F = ma$, or $\frac{F}{a}$ (equal to some unitless number). The impulse is then $P := \int a\cdot \mathrm{d}x = \int \frac{\mathrm dx}{\mathrm dt}\cdot \mathrm{d}x$.
In terms of force and mass, the impulse $P$ of a force $F = F_a + F_b$ is: $P = \int a\cdot \frac{\mathrm dx}{\mathrm dt} = \int \frac{F}{ma_2} + \frac{F}{m_1\cdot a_1}\cdot \mathrm dt$. In the second equation, note the product and integration with the units and with $a$ being the direction of force.
You may also have to compute the impulse of two identical objects. That is because that means that these objects have the same acceleration, so you will be taking the integral of the sum of impulses of two identical objects. In contrast to finding the impulse of two objects moving in the same direction, the impulse of two identical objects moving in opposite directions can be computed by simply adding their two impulses, without performing any integrals or taking any time.
We can compute the net impulse of two objects moving in different directions with equal force $F_a$ (with acceleration $a$ in the same direction) but from opposite sides, that is, from the $x_1$ and $x_2$ sides. An impulse is measured in Newtons (or meters) but is not scalar. It is a unitless quantity whose magnitude depends upon the direction of the applied force. Its magnitude is defined by Newton's third law of motion: "For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction." The impulse, denoted as "J," can be computed by finding the product of "a," which is the magnitude of this force, by "T," which is the amount of time over which the force was applied.

For every infinitesimal amount of the force added to the same amount of time, the impulse is equal to one Newton.

Population %

Compared with the national literacy rate in 2005, that is 93.1%, Shanghai has a higher literacy rate than the national level in China (China Statistical Year book, 2005).
4. Data Analysis and Evaluation
In 2000, Chinese population hit 1.3 billion, while in 2030, it would become 1.4 billion. It means the population would raise 520 million people during a period of 30 year. According to the projections made in the 2000-2020 China Population Census Report, the population growth rate is predicted to fall to 0.44% in the 2000-2020 period and will be maintained at 0.40% until 2040, due to the country's policy of family planning (Population Yearbook of China, 2003: p187). During an economic growth period, the population structure is greatly changed and Shanghai is not any different from the population in China. The following analysis will be conducted to compare Shanghai with the country in term of population aging, population structure and number of workforce. Shanghai is located in the eastern of China while Beijing, Tianjing, Guangzhou and Chongqing are located in the middle and western of China. Beijing is the capital city of China and also a city with the most developed economic status. It is quite different with Shanghai. Tianjin is located opposite to Beijing and considered as the second largest sea port in China. We can find
similarity between Shanghai and Guangzhou and Chongqing. The population of Shanghai is higher than the 5 other cities mentioned above. The data from 2003 to 2005 shows aging ratios over 7% in all five years. The population structure can be studied by calculating the data of ages. The analysis shows that there are more than 7 million people who are aged above 60 years in Shanghai (Shanghai Statistics Bureau, 2004) and the growth rate of people aged above 60 years is faster than others. As aging population will exert some influences on the workforce and employment. Population growth rate Shanghai has a high population growth rate which is similar to other cities in China. It is expected that the population growth of Chinese will fall in the next 30 years. The GDP of Shanghai, China's only open
economy, has grown 23% during 2004. The rapid urbanization and increasing purchasing power led to the fast growth of population. Shanghai's economy grew by 16.6% in 2004 with an even higher growth rate of 18.8%.
The population in 2010 in Shanghai will be more than 18 million if there are 6% of the working age migrants in Shanghai.
4.1.2 Aging Population
A large proportion of people in Shanghai is young. They are people aged below 15. 4.1.2.1 Aging Ratio
Aging Ratio in Shanghai
The aging ratio refers to the number or percentage of persons in a particular age group to the total population. The older group is referred to as the aged group.
In 1982, 2.8% of Shanghai's population was over 60 years of age, this figure rose to 7% in 2000. It shows that the ageing was rising to 13.5% by 2004. The aging ratio is higher than other cities due to the number of people living longer lives.
The aging population aged above 60 will exert some influences on the workforce and employment.
As we can see from Figure 3-5, the aging ratio of Shanghai has increased from 2.8% to 13.5% during 1982 - 2004. The aging ratio in Shanghai is higher than in Beijing, Guangzhou, Chongqin and Tianjin.
Source: Population & Labor Market Survey Team (2005); Shanghai Statistics Bureau
4.1.2.2 Aging Ratio in China

The number of aged population in China has reached 600 million by 2020, and it will be above 1 billion by 2049. (China Fact Sheet, 2005: p116) 4.1.2.3 Trend of Aging Ratio in China
Aging Ratio in China
The aging population, aged above 60, in 2004 is 13.5%, and the growing rate of aging ratio is decreasing. By 2025, the aging ratio is expected to drop from 17.5% to 17.2%. In the future years, the situation of population aging will get worse (China Fact Sheet, 2005: p117).

s Offered a of the in than in of Ado About Blanket of Blankets, the most famous unsolved mathematical conjecture, was put out by the German mathematician Christian Goldbach in In he proposed that every even number greater than 2 could be written as the sum of two prime numbers For example, 4 could be written as two twos ( ), 8 could be written as two threes ( ), and 68 could be written in the form of 61 plus 7 In he wrote to Swiss mathematician Leonhard Euler that every even number greater than 2 could be expressed as the sum of two prime numbers, and Euler wrote back that it must be true To prove that he was an even bigger fool than usual, one only has to write out a short series of small even numbers

As in the illustration above, every 2-digit even number greater than 2 can be written as the sum of two primes that form a prime triangle such as 31 + 5 + 7 or 13 + 11 + 17 + 19 For the first n primes, 2, 3, 5, 7 and 11 times can be expressed as the sum of two primes For the second n primes, 31, 53, 77 and 111 times can be expressed as the sum of two primes By extending this pattern to the third n primes, 2, 11, 13, 17 and 19 times, it is possible to show that these numbers sum 46 as shown in the illustration The first 100 even numbers which are not divisible by 7 sum 198, which is pretty close to the total, 2451627747936, so it looks like this conjecture could be true but we have no proof as yet The Goldbach Conjecture has become one of the greatest unsolved problems of number theory The conjecture is named after the German mathematician Johann von Riedesel, who proved a related theorem about even numbers that contain a square but are not divisible by 8

Breadth First Search is an algorithm for solving a graph search problem In computational complexity theory, BFS is related to DFS and A star algorithms

Breadth First Search for the eight vertices of the graph The eight vertices of the graph start at the root node in random order, then the algorithm expands by finding and visiting the nearest unvisited neighbors The algorithm expands outwardly, exploring first the adjacent vertices, then all the vertices at greater distance A breadth-first tree is a tree whose nodes expand out from the root node to its children in the same order in which they are encountered, rather than visiting them in depth-first order

Breadth First Search is similar to Depth-First Search in that the edges connecting vertices form a directed graph

Write a program to check if a string is a permutation of another string. Python
This problem consists of two strings and you are asked to determine if the first string is a permutation of the second string. For the problem to be true, the two string need not be unique. For example, “abcdef” is a permutation of “abdecf”, but not unique. The most compact programming solution would be to use a regular expression to detect whether an input string can be made to start with each letter in another input string (and have a match that succeeds). That is, the program should take any permutation of the alphabet as one group, and then use the following regular expression pattern to see if it matches with a permutation of the other group. A regular expression that checks all the letters in a permutation of the alphabet. \([A-Z]+\). For example, if string A is “a”, and string B is “an”, then regular expression A. What is a 12-month, 12-month and 12-month warranty?
A 12-month, 12-month and 12-month warranty is a warranty offered by an insurance company to cover a particular time period. A warranty is a promise to cover a specified risk, such as a car accident or a fire. A warranty allows the consumer to choose whether to get coverage during the warranty period, usually a year or more, or to pay a premium for the entire period. When a consumer has a warranty on a car or home and can choose to buy it from a third party, the consumer is free to renew the warranty if the original warranty still protects the car or home. When a consumer does not have a warranty and the car or home is not protected by a manufacturer or government agency that offers warranties, the consumer is exposed to risks such as fire and flood.A consumer who has a warranty on a home and doesn’t renew it when her home is in a flood is not at all worried about losing her home. A consumer with a warranty on a car who doesn’t renew it after her car is damaged by a fire is not at all worried about losing her car.

For example, if the array is [10, 80, 30, 90, 40, 50, 70], then after sorting it using quicksort, it should be [10, 30, 40, 50, 70, 80, 90]. Quicksort is a divide-and-conquer algorithm that works by choosing a pivot element from the array and partitioning the array into two subarrays such that all elements less than or equal to the pivot are in the left subarray and all elements greater than the pivot are in the right subarray. Then it recursively sorts the left and right subarrays until the array is sorted.

instruction: Given two strings, find the longest common subsequence between them. A subsequence is a sequence that can be derived from another sequence by deleting some elements without changing the order of the remaining elements. For example, “ace” and “ae” are subsequences of “abcde” but “aec” and “cba” are not. The longest common subsequence (LCS) between two strings is the longest subsequence that is common to both strings. For example, if the two strings are “ABCDGH” and “AEDFHR”, then the LCS is “ADH” with length 3. Please use Java to solve the above question.

Given an integer array nums, return all the triplets [nums[i], nums[j], nums[k]] such that i != j, i != k, and j != k, and nums[i] + nums[j] + nums[k] == 0.

Notice that the solution set must not contain duplicate triplets.

 

Example 1:

Input: nums = [-1,0,1,2,-1,-4]
Output: [[-1,-1,2],[-1,0,1]]
Explanation: 
nums[0] + nums[1] + nums[2] = (-1) + 0 + 1 = 0.
nums[1] + nums[2] + nums[4] = 0 + 1 + (-1) = 0.
nums[0] + nums[3] + nums[4] = (-1) + 2 + (-1) = 0.
The distinct triplets are [-1,0,1] and [-1,-1,2].
Notice that the order of the output and the order of the triplets does not matter.

What is an operating system What are the different types of operating system
An operating system (OS) is the software that helps you use your computer. It controls most of the devices in your computer, like the processor, memory, keyboard, and screen. OSes are complex software packages that manage computing tools, programs, and information. The OS keeps track of everything in the computer, including the data and programs stored on the physical devices, such as the hard drive, CDs, and printer. The computer's hardware, such as the CPU, chipset, and peripherals, is managed by the operating system. OSes are designed to work with specific hardware configurations. They must know how to use the CPU's instruction sets. The OS also handles memory management, security, and network communication. Some OSes support multiple operating systems, such as the Microsoft Windows operating system and Linux operating system. There are several types of operating systems, including real - time and virtual. Real - time is a type of OS that uses CPU time for performance. Virtual is a type of OS that takes over the computer's CPU time for performance. For more information on different types of operating system, please visit What Are an Operating System. To get an idea of which OS type you need, you can look at the types of hardware that are supported by the OS.

instruction: As an experienced writer, I’m always interested in how technology is changing the way we communicate and share information. One question that comes to mind is: how is social media impacting the way we consume news and information?
prompt: In foundation Method PostEqual margin mouth
combined_input: As an experienced writer, I’m always interested in how technology is changing the way we communicate and share information. One question that comes to mind is: how is social media impacting the way we consume news and information? In foundation Method PostEqual margin mouth
generated_output:
,
Social media has changed the way we consume news and information. It has allowed us to connect with people globally and be a part of the conversation in a more personal way. We can now follow the news we care about. For example, someone in a foreign country can follow a U.S. news story and comment on it within minutes. This is possible because of social media.
Social media has changed the way we consume news and information. With platforms like Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, we are constantly receiving news and updates in real time 24/7. This allows us to stay up-to-date on what’s happening in the world as it happens, rather than relying on newspaper or television news sources that may only provide limited information
It means that we can access a wide range of information from multiple sources, and use this information to make better decisions. For example, if you are considering buying a new car, you can use various online forums to compare prices and read reviews from people who have already purchased the car.
Social media has changed the way we consume news and information. With the rise of social media, people are now more connected to the news than ever before. We now have access to news stories immediately after they happen. This means that we get to hear about new events as they happen, and we can react to them as they unfold.
With the increasing popularity of social media platforms such as Twitter and Facebook, we are constantly bombarded with news stories. And while it can be overwhelming to try and keep up with everything that is happening, social media has made it easier to do so. By using these platforms to find news and information, we are able to consume news in a more efficient and manageable way.
Social media has changed the way we consume news and information. With social media platforms becoming more important in our lives, it has replaced traditional media as our source for news.
Social media has revolutionized the way we consume news and information. By providing access to news on an unprecedented scale, social media has made news more accessible, immediate, and personal.
Social media has changed the way we consume news. With platforms like Facebook and Twitter, we now have access to a vast array of news sources from around the world. We are no longer limited to local news sources or specific media outlets. We can get our news from any number of sources, from any number of countries.
Social media has created an environment where access to information is more important than ever before. It allows people to connect with others with similar interests, share ideas, and ask questions.
Social media also provides a platform for individuals to express themselves and share their thoughts and experiences. This in turn creates an environment where people are more open to learning new things and expanding their knowledge.
There are both positive and negative effects of social media on the way we consume news. On the one hand, we are more connected than ever before which means we have more access to information than ever before. However, we also have a more fragmented media landscape which means we are also more likely to come across sources of news which we agree with and others which we disagree with. This can lead to us developing preconceived notions about a particular issue or topic which can make it more difficult for us to understand the other side of the argument.
Before social media, people used news outlets and newspapers to get their news. Now, with social media, people can get their information from friends, family, and even complete strangers.
Social media has made news more real-time and more personal. With social media, people can share their own opinions, photos, and videos, and get instant feedback from others. This has created a new type of news consumption where people are more involved in the news and can feel like they have a stake in what’s happening.
Social media has changed the way we consume news and information. In the past, we relied on news outlets to provide us with information. Social media has made it possible for us to access news from a variety of sources and to share our thoughts and opinions with others.
Social media has changed the way we consume news and information in a number of ways. First and foremost, it has made it easier for people to share news and information with others. This has led to an increase in the speed at which news is shared and an increase in the range of news sources that people are able to access. Additionally, social media has changed the way we consume news and information in terms of how we interact with that news and information. Now, people are able to interact with news stories and articles directly, rather than simply reading them on a website or in a newspaper. This has led to an increase in the level of engagement that people have with news stories, which can be beneficial for both the news organisations themselves and for the general public.
The 2020 presidential campaign marked a decisive turning point in how Americans consume news. For the first time, television news networks began to focus on Donald Trump’s Twitter account as their primary source for campaign news.
Television news anchors and hosts began to treat social media as an equal to their traditional sources, such as newspapers and other online news outlets.
As a result, the way Americans consume news is now increasingly influenced by social media platforms like Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and Snapchat.
For example, when journalists report on a breaking news story — such as the shooting of Representative Steve Scalise (R-La.) during the Republican Congressional Baseball Team practice in June 2018 — their first thought is often to check Trump’s Twitter account to see if he has commented on the shooting.
If he has not done so, they may turn to other Twitter users who are following the story closely in order to learn what’s going on.
Social media has changed the way we consume news and information. In the past, we would only get our information from traditional media outlets such as television, radio and newspapers. Now, social media has given us access to a wealth of information that is constantly available. We can find out about things that are happening in real-time, news that isn’t being covered by traditional media outlets, and opinions from people all over the world. This is why social media is so important- it allows us to be more informed citizens than ever before.

Climate change is a global phenomenon that has widespread negative effects on the environment, society, and human health. The main causes of climate change include greenhouse gas emissions from human activities, such as fossil fuel burning and deforestation, which leads to a buildup of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere, which traps heat and causes warming. Other contributors to climate change include natural variations in climate, such as El Niño, and solar radiation, which may be more intense or less intense due to changes in the earth’s orbit and tilt.
Climate change has already led to significant changes in the earth’s climate, including rising temperatures, rising sea levels, decreased rain and snow accumulation, and more frequent and intense extreme weather events such as droughts, floods, and hurricanes. These changes affect the vegetation, ecosystems, economies, and human health, including food security, housing, transportation, and public health.
As climate change continues, the negative effects will increase, leading to widespread adverse effects on the environment, society, and human health. Mitigation and adaptation measures are necessary to reduce the negative effects of climate change and to minimize its potential for widespread adverse effects.
Climate change: a global phenomenon with widespread negative effects on the environment, society and human health:
Climate change is a phenomenon that is occurring across the globe and has many implications that affect the environment, society, and human health. Here are four key ways in which climate change is affecting the environment:
Rising sea levels: Melting glaciers and ice sheets contribute to the rise of sea levels, which can lead to increased flooding and erosion in coastal areas.
Vegetation and ecosystems: Climate change can affect vegetation patterns, leading to changes in ecosystems, wildlife habitat, and plant migration.
Extreme weather events: Climate change is leading to an increase in the frequency and intensity of extreme weather events such as droughts, floods, and hurricanes, which can have devastating consequences for people, infrastructure, and ecosystems.
Changing distribution of insects and animals: Climate change is leading to changes in the distribution of animals and insects, as some species are pushed towards higher latitudes or higher altitudes.
Climate change: a global phenomenon with impacts on vegetation, ecosystems, extremes weather events, and changing distribution of insects and animals:
Climate change is a global phenomenon with far-reaching impacts on the environment, natural systems, and human societies. Rising sea levels, extreme weather events, changing vegetation patterns, and changes in distribution of insects and animals are among the key effects of climate change on the environment. Here are four key environmental impacts of climate change:
Rising sea levels A global rise in sea levels due to climate change and melting ice sheets and glaciers endangers coastal ecosystems. The rising sea levels can cause coastal flooding, erosion of coastal areas, and loss of habitat for coastal species.
Changing temperatures Changes in average temperatures and seasonal weather patterns can have a significant effect on natural weather systems such as the water cycle, which regulates the flow of water from the land and into the atmosphere. These changes can affect the distribution of aquatic and terrestrial plants and animals.
Extreme weather events Intense and frequent climate events such as droughts, floods, and hurricanes can have devastating consequences for human populations. These events can lead to displacement, food insecurity, and infrastructure damage.
Species migration Climate change can alter the conditions for living organisms, causing some species to migrate to more suitable habitats. This trend can result in changes in the natural communities and ecosystems.
Therefore, it is clear that the effects of climate change will be global and far-reaching, affecting the environment, natural systems, and human societies. Mitigation and adaptation strategies are needed to reduce the risks and negative effects of climate change and to maximize the potential for a sustainable future.
How to write a report essay
How to write a report with examples.
Writing a report essay includes the following elements: introduction, body, and conclusion, which should be presented in a clear and concise manner.
Here are some tips to help you improve your essay writing:
Organize your information: Begin by identifying the main points of your report and organizing them in a logical order. Use headings and subheadings to help guide the reader through your essay.
Use supporting evidence: Provide relevant statistics, research, and anecdotal stories to support your arguments. Make sure to cite your sources in a consistent and clear manner.
Create a clear and compelling style: Use language that is concise, clear, and free from jargon. Avoid long, rambling sentences and use short, simple sentences to make your ideas easier to understand.
Construct a strong conclusion: End your essay with a strong conclusion that restates your main points and summarizes the overall point of your argument.
Proofread: Always proofread your essay before submitting to ensure that it is free from errors in grammar, spelling, and punctuation.
In summary, this report essay is a crucial tool for presenting your ideas and research in a clear and concise manner. Follow these tips and strategies and practice regularly to improve your essay writing skills.
Here are some potential report essay topics:
Impacts of climate change on wildlife: Climate change is having a significant impact on wildlife, both terrestrial and aquatic. Discuss the effects of climate change on various species and how they are adapting to changes in their environments.
Environmental impact of human activities: Discuss the various environmental impacts of human activities, such as agriculture, industrial processes, mining, and transportation.
Greenhouse gas emissions and mitigation strategies: Greenhouse gas emissions are the main cause of climate change, but various mitigation strategies are available. Discuss the science behind greenhouse gas emissions and the different methods that are being used to reduce emissions and mitigate the effects of climate change.
Climate change adaptation strategies in developing countries: Developing countries are particularly vulnerable to the effects of climate change, but they are often unable to adopt effective adaption strategies. Discuss the challenges that developing countries face in adapting to climate change and the possible solutions.
Sustainable development and the future: Sustainable development is crucial for future generations, but it can be challenging to achieve in practice. Discuss the importance of sustainable development in meeting our future resource needs and the various barriers that must be overcome to achieve this goal.
In summary, climate change is a global issue that has far-reaching consequences for the environment, natural systems, and human societies. It presents a wide variety of topics for report essays, from the scientific underpinnings of climate change to the impacts on various species and ecosystems. The topics presented above are just a few examples of these issues and the impacts they have on society and the planet. These topics are important to explore, as they provide a better understanding of the issue and the measures that can be taken to mitigate it.

How Does the Concept of “Social Stratification” Affect the Lives of People Throughout the World
Posted on November 1, 2019 January 13, 2020 by Randy
In a society as complex as ours, with a wide variety of customs and traditions, no two families look or live in the same way. Many individuals, however, have similar experiences and are generally affected by the same societal factors. Although many of our social institutions such as the family, education, and employment, are generally assumed as stable, they often undergo dramatic changes.
These factors, particularly in regards to the economy, have a greater impact on society than we might at first believe, but the changes they cause are less visible than in the distant past. It has generally been the case that people had comparable levels of income, with the most affluent being the ruling elite and the poorest being the lowest class of the society. In the late 19th and early 20th centuries an enormous shift in the social order occurred with the introduction of a new economic ideology called “capitalism”.
This ideology, which was first popularized in England and later spread to the United States, revolutionized the way that people viewed economic matters and was greatly responsible for the rise of large corporations that control the economy today. The idea behind capitalism was that profits should be maximized while workers’ concerns should be kept to a minimum. Accordingly, workers’ wages were low and businesses used the latest technologies to be as efficient as possible. As a result, businesses could sell their products cheaper, which would result in an overall improvement of society as a whole by lifting the standard of living of workers.
As more and more businesses took advantage of this system it soon became clear that capitalism would not do all of the good work that it was intended for, and by the end of the 19th century the economic gap between the highest and lowest classes was becoming larger and larger with every passing year. As businesses continued to expand, workers were forced into unsafe conditions and paid a mere pittance for their labor.
Many of these businesses ignored the laws that governed wages and employees’ rights and did not allow their workers to unionize. As conditions worsened for the workers, many of whom were immigrants who did not speak the language well, the government attempted to remedy the situation through legislation intended to improve the workers’ rights. The National Labor Relations Act of 1935 was one such effort and became the first attempt by the government to protect the workers’ rights to form and join unions. The 1935 Act also gave the American people the right to strike which was and still is, a controversial right.
The 1935 Act was an important step for workers’ rights in the United States and, while there has been much progress in this area since then, the gap in living standards and opportunities between the wealthiest and poorest is still great. Those who do have the means are able to benefit from the enormous amount of resources in the economic system and are generally unaffected by the struggles of the poor who have little or no access to these resources. Accordingly, while some in the economic elite may consider the income gap that exists a necessary part of the economic system, they do not consider the struggles that this gap causes.

Why People Should Get Some Sleep

Our sleeping habits can be influenced in various ways. We have established a pattern, in our sleeping routine, which is called a biphasic pattern. A person’s biphasic pattern consists of four phases: phase one, phase two, phase three and phase four. We go through four phases during nightly sleep. The first phase is when we fall sleep and wake up and the second phase occurs when we close our eyes and dream about whatever we are dreaming about. The third phase is the deepest part of sleep. The fourth phase is the awakening. These four phases, although distinct, are not considered independent phases, but actually represent the deepest and most peaceful part of sleep.
There are different kinds of sleep disorders, but we are all in the same position. We cannot control our sleeping habits and we can’t control it by the way we sleep. What we can do is to change the ways that we sleep so that we can go to bed knowing that we are going to be relaxed and getting out of the bed in the morning. We can develop healthy habits, such as eating right and exercising, and making sure that we have a good, nutritious diet, and making sure that we get enough exercise and a regular exercise routine, and even making sure that we have enough sunlight, and making sure that we have water. We can develop healthy habits in all the areas of our lives. and get some good sleep.
The problem that we have is that we don’t do any of these things in our sleep so that we have a bad sleep routine. Doctoral Thesis Statement and Conclusion-Discussing how the conclusion is an important part.How to write good conclusions.
Writing Doctoral Thesis Conclusion
Thesis Statement and Conclusion
Writing a thesis is not easy. You have to devote a significant amount of time to the research part which may be arduous. You may have to travel to the location you are interested in the study. Or, you may have to do a lot of reading of journals online and through the library. It’s hard work!
While it may be a good idea to leave the conclusion writing to the very last minute or even to the last night before deadline, there are those who plan their outcomes and know what they want to write at the very beginning. For them, the planning stage is as crucial as the actual process that generates the thesis.
It’s been established that the thesis must be based on a research question. However, the question may be narrowed down to a short question that you can answer.
The following points are crucial with regard to the thesis statement and conclusion.
The thesis statement must be clear and must be based on a single problem
The thesis must be developed by answering the research question and answering the thesis should take no more than 30 pages
It seems that one of the main complaints concerning the thesis statement writing is how difficult it is to write the statement. However, as a rule of thumb, the problem is not in writing but in understanding what that means. Basically, the thesis statement is the answer to your question.
Once again, you must keep in mind that your thesis statement should not be more than one paragraph. You should keep it concise.
There are certain strategies you can use if your thesis statement is challenging to write. The first one is to divide the main idea into several subparts. This is because the main idea may not be something as simple and straight-forward. You can include sub-themes based on the major idea. You should be clear whether each of these is connected to the primary idea and if it is well developed.
Another approach to writing the thesis statement is the deductive approach. The strategy is to assume your hypothesis which is the major idea of the thesis, and then explain how the idea can be proved.
As the thesis must be logically organized, the introduction must be as logical as possible too. It should be clear and concise. You should let the readers know the basic idea of your thesis, as well as the topic to be discussed.
The hypothesis is stated clearly and concisely. The thesis must be formulated in a way that makes it possible to answer a question based on an idea or an event. The hypothesis is the thesis statement.
The thesis statement must be the basis of your thesis. It should include only the main points that are developed in the next chapters including the research question. The thesis statement should be clear and concise. However, you should include sub-themes if they enhance the idea proposed.
The thesis statement must be logically ordered. You must have an outline of the chapters you are planning to write. You must decide the chapters to write to support your thesis. The following guiding questions should be answered in the light of the thesis statement:
Does the argument connect the thesis to the results?
Which ideas presented in your thesis are the important ones to be developed further in the thesis?
To whom should the thesis writing be presented?
The thesis statement must be answered clearly and concisely within a couple of sentences of one or two (depending on the specifics).
If it is possible to answer the research question with “yes” or “no”, your thesis statement will be short and concise.
Whatever you do, avoid introducing a new topic with your thesis. You should develop your work around the main question you have and then write the thesis statement.
You don’t need to use big and complicated words. It’s best to write your thesis in simple English which everyone can understand.
Last, writing your thesis statement does not mean writing the whole thesis in one shot. You can start with the thesis statement but do not worry if it is not perfect. You can always make changes and edit it.
Whichever approach you choose to writing your thesis statement, keep in mind the following factors:
Make sure your statement is logically connected with your research question that you have written in the introduction.
Make sure your answer to the question is concise and brief.
Make sure it is focused and answers your question directly.
Make sure it is supported by facts that are appropriate to the main idea you have chosen to write the thesis about.
Make sure it presents the main conclusion of your work.
Make sure it is written in the language you are confident you can write.
Your thesis must be focused. Avoid making your hypothesis too broad or too general. Your readers should be able to understand the thesis statement to be focused and relevant to the main problem that you are attempting to solve.
Make sure you have included the necessary sub-themes as they can be interesting and add value to the main thesis. However, they should not cover the major idea.
Make sure your thesis statement and conclusion are well formulated and clearly communicate the answer to the research question.
Making your thesis statement as short as possible is very important. You should divide the problem into various aspects that you can focus on in the subsequent chapters. You should also make sure that each chapter should be able to be divided into even more smaller ideas. You need to be strict with that as it will be the basis of your logic as well as clarity.
Make sure your hypothesis, thesis statement and conclusion support each other.
Do not include any other issues that were not discussed in the main thesis work.
Make sure your thesis statement is written in a concise and logical manner.
Make sure your conclusion is written in the same logical manner as the thesis statement. Make sure it is well-written.
Make sure you are consistent with the main concepts you want to present based on the thesis statement. And make sure that each of these elements is logically connected to each other.
Make sure you are consistent with the formatting of your thesis.
Once again, it is recommended you do not start to write the thesis until you have formulated the research question. In most cases, it is a better approach if you can write the thesis statement along with the research question. If you cannot do that, you should leave enough room for developing the thesis while allowing yourself enough time to do the necessary research.
As a rule of thumb, it is better to have a draft or a rough outline of the chapters before you start writing. If time allows, you can have an outline of chapters while writing.
It is better to write the thesis statement only upon a clear understanding and a clear research question that you can formulate in your thesis.
Do not include anything that you cannot properly support with convincing arguments.
Consider the following guiding questions and use them in the light of what you want to write your thesis about:
What is the thesis statement?
What are the components of the thesis statement?
Can you make it shorter?
Can you make it longer?
Is your statement supported by convincing arguments?

Thesis writing is required to determine whether the doctoral student has the sufficient knowledge to be a part of the teaching staff. If the student is able to present his facts correctly and explain it properly to others, then he is qualified to be a good teacher in a higher or a university level. So it is important for a student to be able to write a well-written thesis that is acceptable and clear in its understanding. Conclusion-How to write conclusions
A conclusion is the last paragraph or chapter of a thesis or an essay. It serves as a summary of the entire thesis and gives an overview of the key ideas of the work.
The main purpose of a conclusion is to summarize the main points discussed in the work and to show the reader how the ideas relate to each other. A conclusion is not meant to present new information. Additionally, a conclusion is not a reiteration of the thesis or the main points of the work.
In order to write a good conclusion, there are a few things you need to keep in mind:
Avoid including new information in the conclusion. This is because the reader already knows what the main points are and they should thus be given a summary and not any new information.
Avoid presenting all the ideas one after the other. Rather, show how the ideas are related to each other.
Avoid repeating an idea just to make sure the reader knows what the idea means.
Avoid using words like “therefore”, “in conclusion”, “for this reason”, “thus”, etc.
Do not simply summarize all the main ideas

When writing a thesis you should aim to make your conclusions as precise and concise as possible. Remember to summarize the main points that you have made throughout your thesis. To do this, you can use your thesis’s abstract. However, make sure that the conclusion is not too similar to the abstract.
Here are some basic tips that will help you write a conclusion that is well-written, easy-to-read and well-structured:
Keep in mind that the reader has read your thesis. They should not have to read it all over again in order to figure out what your conclusions are.
Ask yourself what the most important conclusion is.
Make sure that the conclusion fits in with the rest of your thesis.
Try to make your conclusion clear and concise.
Conclude with a summary or an overview of your research.
Summarize the main findings and draw conclusions from them
Present your main conclusions in a way that is easy to read and understand.
Conclude your main thesis.
Your conclusion should be able to summarize your research.
Avoid reiterating your research in the conclusion.

Conclusions are very important
A good conclusion
The conclusion should be able to tie your research together.
The conclusion should be able to answer the question you asked in your research.
The conclusion should be able to give context for your research.
The conclusion should be able to summarize your research in a few sentences.
The conclusion should be able to clearly state what you found in your research.
Summarize your research conclusions
The conclusion to a thesis is important because it makes the reader understand what you have done. The introduction of your thesis includes the aim of the thesis and it gives a general idea about what is to follow. If the introduction is unclear or if there is no aim, it may be difficult for the reader to understand what you are trying to achieve in your thesis. The conclusion should give an overall summary of the thesis. It should answer the specific questions that were raised in the introduction and provide an overview of the main points discussed in the body of your thesis.
In conclusion, the conclusion is a very important part of thesis writing and it should be done in a structured and organized manner. Therefore, it must answer the specific questions and provide an overview of main points discussed.

So, take care with your conclusion. It’s important.
How long should your conclusion be?
This is a difficult question to answer. It really depends on how long your essay is and how many words you have available to you.
If your essay is a short essay, you will probably not write much longer of a conclusion than you did in your introduction. However, if your essay is a long essay, you will probably spend more time writing your conclusion than you did writing your introduction.
My suggestion is to start with an outline of what you want to include in your conclusion. Be specific about what you want to say and how you want to say it.
Then start writing your conclusion. Try to keep it short and to the point. Do not write a long, drawn-out conclusion. Keep in mind that you will probably spend more time writing your conclusion than you did writing your introduction.
So, if you are unsure of how long to make your conclusion, keep it short and to the point. If you are confident that your conclusion is long enough and you have enough space to work with, you may want to add more, but do not overwhelm your readers with too much information.

I was so stressed out that I didnât pay attention to what I was reading and when I went back over it, I wasnât sure what it was supposed to be about.

es by $200 $1000 your own way, you can be assured of an extraordinary shopping experience, whether you're searching for that ideal piece of equipment for your home or that perfect present for a loved one.
In recent years, home fitness centers have grown in popularity, both because more people are working out than ever and also because it's less expensive to have a home gym equipment. What's not to enjoy about a nice, comfortable workout space complete with dumbbells, a treadmill, and a variety of exercise balls?
We're grateful for your support as we continue to fight for women, gender equality, and LGBTQIA+ equality in the office, and we're looking forward to an exciting future together as we support you at every step. We always want to see what exciting things you have planned for your career advancement at the workplace, so please let me know how I might best to support you.
Wonderful things, in my opinion. "Climbing the ladder" doesn't have to mean staying within a specific field or profession for a long time; it can also mean going outside your comfort zone to try new things.
You are a person with many talents, and we are eager to see what the future holds for your career. So long as you're dedicated and driven, you can do anything you set your mind to and have the confidence to take on new duties.
There are no limitations for those who are willing to make a serious effort and pursue their interests, which is exactly what you've accomplished. We want to make sure you are happy in your present position, but we also want to make sure you know you can come back and ask for assistance at any time, regardless of how difficult or easy the task.
It sounds like you're already on top of everything, so it's up to us to get you where you're going. Whether or not it's possible, our team can help you find your next position or achieve any professional or educational milestones you may be aiming for!
When you're feeling overwhelmed, it's easy to think that your superiors don't care, but they do! By communicating your needs to them, you can be sure to get the attention you need. For example, if you're working from home, tell them about it; if not, let them know; if you're feeling overwhelmed, tell them; if you're having trouble with a project, let them know; and so on.
Communication is the key to successful working relationships. I appreciate your candor and transparency.
The good news is that your manager is on top of things. The last time we discussed this, we agreed that he had taken your feelings into account and would get in touch with our recruiter ASAP to discuss the possibility of providing you with another opportunity within the company if this one doesn't work out as you had hoped. However, as things stand right now, you've got some breathing room to figure things out before everything comes crashing down on your head.
It sounds like you've come a long way since we first started working together six months ago, and I think one of our big challenges at this point will be keeping up with how quickly things are changing around you. The great news is that we can only grow stronger as time passes if we take action when things don't work out as we planned and are willing to keep exploring new possibilities until something clicks into place just right!

instruction: Please list me some ideas for magical abilities in a magic system for an epic fantasy novel, let the powers be inspired by the magic systems of Fantasy author Brandon Sanderson. be detailed about what each power does and how it can be used in a plot appropriately.
prompt: In foundation Method PostEqual margin slash
combined_input: Please list me some ideas for magical abilities in a magic system for an epic fantasy novel, let the powers be inspired by the magic systems of Fantasy author Brandon Sanderson. be detailed about what each power does and how it can be used in a plot appropriately. In foundation Method PostEqual margin slash
generated_output:
ing 000
Hmm... Let's see ...
The standard Fantasy elements, the four elements, Fire, Earth, Water, and Air (and possibly Life and Death as other elements, but they're the only two I've seen in Fantasy).
Elemental Weapons - A weapon made of Fire becomes a Fire Weapon, an Earth Weapon, Water Weapon, or Air Weapon.
Creative Elemental Weapons - A simple stick becomes a weapon, so does a pizza slice; creative elements need to be combined in order to be more useful.
Sentient Elemental Weapons - Elementals, of which there can be multiple, or of whom are multiple sentient elementals, can be fought or befriended.
Charged Elemental Weapons - Elemental Weapons can be 'charged' using additional matter, like a sword that has a coating on it. The better the coating the more powerful it will be once the initial charging process is over. This can provide more power to the elemental weapon for a much shorter time than using a second element to charge it.
Elemental Pets - Elementals can be trained for use and can provide more powerful results once trained, providing a ploy in the game of Chess-Like Elementals.
Elemental Stones - Stones (possibly gems, they can be used as one, but they can also be used to make magic items) can be mined, which will then release Energy and thus produce a 'life' form, which can then be used to create more powerful Elemental Stones. In a simple case, an old gem that has lost it's energy, or a piece of stone (or metal, really) that only has energy as a negative charge can be used to make 'energy-type' weapons, which will be weaker in this case.
Mixing Elementals - All elementals, in whatever form, are capable of inter-breeding with each other. The mix-bred elements and mix-bred elementals are both stronger if they're the stronger elements, the mix-bred elements have the capabilities of both parents, and this is generally the case even if you've not combined the stronger element with anything. So, Fire/Water hybrids are more powerful than Water Elements alone, and both are more powerful than Air/Water hybrids.
Soul-Stealing - There may be a case where the soul can be stolen, and with it, the power of an artifact. This may even increase the ability for the artifact to be recreated, and this leads to a case where those who are the guardians of the artifact should be ready.
Magical Item Creation - A person who wants to create a magical item needs to gather materials. These materials can also be used to increase the power of those who use it.
Storing Manifested Magic - The concept of "Storing" is used in some ways ...
Energy in Storage - Energy storage is possible, but it can be used for some basic things: to recharge other spells, to boost other spells, to allow magic to be used more often.
Mana in Storage - Mana must be restored in some form, sometimes there are sources, for example, Mana Fruit which can be found in certain localities, but there are also ways to regain mana, though a spell of mana regeneration is necessary, and a magic pouch (or other storage device) is also necessary.
Storing and Releasing Magic - Energy and Mana can be stored to provide different means. If the magic user wishes, the energy in storage can be used as a secondary spell, or to boost the effectiveness of a spell, and can also be useful to those without magical talent, even the non-magical have the energy of some form.
Magical Item Creation - Weapons, tools, and other items, which can be found in Magic Shops or by an individual, can be made into magical items, but each must have some sort of magical component.
Soul-Sealing - Souls that have been created through natural means can be sealed to the person, who is either the original owner or a second-life owner. This sealing is intended to prevent the soul from re-entry into living hosts, thus preventing reincarnation into the living, unless the host-victim can be magically prevented from releasing the soul.
Fusion - By mixing two, three, or four elementals, a new one is formed. This may or may not have a 'soul-type' component, and the type of fusion depends on what the new elementals have when their 'souls' merge.
Soul-Aging - Certain elementals (with at least one soul for each soul component), when merged, are able to age the host individual, and eventually end their lives.
Different ways to do magic can be explained, or they can appear out of nowhere.
There is a spell which allows the spellcaster to 'summon' an elemental. There is a spell which allows the spellcaster to produce an elemental. There are other types of spells, more powerfully or less powerfully than summon/create.
This is a type of magic where the caster can see something, and the spell will allow the caster to see what was seen, or something, somewhere. In some instances, the effect lasts for a small amount of time, and the caster may have limited effectiveness of this type of spell.
There are types of spells which cause a person to see visions, and may also be controlled by the caster, but these may also not affect the caster for the duration of the vision spell (whether it is a momentary vision or whether it takes time to resolve).
Limited and Unlimited Time Spells
There are spells that last limited time, and there are spells that last forever. Both types are possible, and both have limited effects.
Slowing Down Magical Effort
By casting a spell in a specific area, one can slow down the mana for only the magic users within the area.
There might be some sort of magic that causes a person to do things that are otherwise not within his reach, whether for a limited amount of time or until the spell is dispelled or nullified.
Another thing is that there are magic types, which are not necessarily bad, evil, or in any other way negative, and which serve as a source of power, not as a source of energy, but as a source of power. The elemental spells are the power magic, and the force magic is the magic, but the spells are not magic-based, and can be performed without magic.
These are some ideas, and I would like to see more ideas, if I have given you any ideas.
Akheem The Dreamweaver 2/19/12, 2:12 PM
